title: Publisher Rocket: How to use the KEYWORD function

tactics.name: keyword research focus
tactics.description: Prioritize reader search terms over author intent when selecting keywords
steps: Search for keywords using Publisher Rocket
caveats: Sponsored listings are not reliable indicators
source_quotes: it's about you as a reader not you as an author
just because somebody searched it does not mean it will fit in your keyword search bar

tactics.name: Avoid High Competitive Scores
tactics.description: New authors should avoid keywords with competitive scores over 48 to maximize visibility.
source_quotes: if you are a new author... stay away from anything that is over 45 48

tactics.name: Optimize Keyword Placement
tactics.description: Position keywords in titles/subtitles to improve competitive score and visibility.
caveats: Requires strong author following for KU success
source_quotes: keyword is in the title or subtitle... determines competitive score

tactics.name: Keyword Placement in Titles/Subtitles
tactics.description: Prioritize keywords in titles and subtitles for better visibility, especially for free or Kindle Unlimited books.
steps: Avoid including 'Kindle Unlimited' in subject line
caveats: Keywords may not align with book content
source_quotes: she's got 18 books that's where it's judging the popularity 18 book she's putting everything Mafia...

tactics.name: Keyword Competition Analysis
tactics.description: Evaluate keywords using Publisher Rocket to balance search volume and competition.
steps: Check competitive score and search volume
Prioritize moderate competition with reasonable searches
Test niche keywords like 'paranormal romance shifter'
caveats: Competitive scores may not align with actual market dynamics
source_quotes: the market for paranormal um shifter books is highly less competitive

heuristics.name: keyword specificity
heuristics.condition: If keyword search returns too many results, refine search terms
source_quotes: if you're too vague it's gonna give you a lot and that's not necessarily a bad thing um if you want to look through things

heuristics.name: Low Review Boost
heuristics.condition: If review count is below 200, prioritize niche
source_quotes: 34 reviews but he says Mafia romance... number 21 free in Kindle store

heuristics.name: Low Competition Boost
heuristics.condition: If competition score is low, prioritize keywords with high search volume
source_quotes: free paranormal romance Kindle... 85 competitive score...

heuristics.name: Review-Driven Niche Selection
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize niche keywords
source_quotes: reviews are low on a lot of these

claims.statement: Keywords in titles/subtitles improve search visibility
source_quotes: I'm really big on authors having their subtitle being the genre or the Trope

claims.statement: KU earnings calculations assume download = sales, which may overstate revenue
source_quotes: system is thinking she sold the 399 book... in reality didn't make that much

claims.statement: Books with low review counts can rank high if keywords align with search intent
source_quotes: she's got 25 ratings and she's reading 97 000 in the Kindle Store...

claims.statement: Paranormal shifter romance has lower competition than Mafia-themed niches
source_quotes: the market for paranormal um shifter books is highly less competitive

niche_patterns.description: Leverage popular genres with specific tropes for keyword targeting
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Popular genres with defined tropes generate consistent search volume
source_quotes: most of them have Mafia somewhere in there

niche_patterns.description: Niche combinations with specific constraints yield better keyword rankings
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Limits competition while maintaining keyword relevance
source_quotes: keyword is in the title or subtitle... determines competitive score

niche_patterns.description: Combine genre-specific keywords with platform constraints (e.g., free or Kindle Unlimited) to target niche audiences
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Leverages keyword overlap between genre, platform, and pricing models
source_quotes: if this had been another book that had looked like a mafia romance...

niche_patterns.description: Combine broad genres with subgenres and niche markets for lower competition
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Leverages specific keyword variations with lower review counts
source_quotes: shifters is in here paranormal shifter romance
